result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando L Smart

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Orlando L Smart appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Orlando L Smart.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense acknowledged receipt of discovery.  Defense requests a final and pretrial dates.  Court set dates as requested.  Court ordered all pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Orlando L Smart in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Orlando L Smart.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Conen.  
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Richards, Br. 30. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30. Court vacates the 10/3/2022 Jury Trial.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Orlando L Smart in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Orlando L Smart appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defense counsel has not received an offer and informed the Court there is a possible DPA and requests additional time.   Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Orlando L Smart in court with attorney Colleen Cullen who appears for attorney Corey Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense advises the Court they are in receipt of discovery and are awaiting an offer. State advises the Court this case is being considered for a DPA and requests defendant complete a TAD evaluation. 
Court orders matter adjounred for status. Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Orlando L Smart in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/4/22 @ 2:30p
Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court was not in session on 2/22/2022, due to the weather courts were closed. Court date for 2/22/2022 has been vacated. Case adjourned to 4/04/2022, at 2:30 p.m. in OCCR. Notice has been mailed.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/22/22 @ 2:30p
